channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: NSF 3 Year Graduate Fellowship Information Session to be held Feb. 18th
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 18, 2026 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - The NSF GRFP provides 3 years of salary and tuition for Masters and PhD students in 30+ STEM fields. Rensselaer students earn this prestigious award every year. Seniors, 1st year grad students (fall 2026) who are U.S. citizens and permanent residents are eligible. Email madige@rpi.edu for information or Register for the virtual session: https://surveys.rpi.edu/jfe/form/SV_6L3FFwv0qCROrvE
item.author: Students

item.title: “Where’s the Data?” Celebrate Love Data Week with RPI Libraries!
item.description: RPI Libraries celebrates Love Data Week 2026, an international data event held annually in February. This year’s theme, “Where’s the Data?” Explore free Love Data Week events around the world at-a-glance…
item.author: Students

item.title: RPI at Work Hosts Systems Engineering & Technology Management Review
item.description: Date: Friday, February 13, 2026 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - This 30-minute information session is hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., and will focus on RPI’s Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree. The degree is digitally delivered, flexible, and project-based to prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. The session will highlight program details and how you can select graduate certificates relevant to your work to complete…
item.author: Community

item.title: STS Colloquium: Scott Knowles, PhD, Northeastern University- The Disaster Haggyo: Participatory Action Research for Disaster Justice
item.description: Join the STS Department for a colloquium with Scott Knowles, Ph.D titled “The Disaster Haggyo: Participatory Action Research for Disaster Justice” on February 11 at 11:30 am in Sage 5711.
item.author: Community

item.title: The Future of Computing Research Collaboration (FCRC) 2026 Annual Workshop
item.description: This full-day workshop brings together RPI and IBM leadership, faculty, researchers, and students to highlight strategic priorities, research progress across the four FCRC tracks (AI Algorithms, AI HW/SW Codesign, Semiconductor Technology, and Quantum Computing), and future collaboration opportunities. Visit https://fcrc.rpi.edu/news for the agenda and registration link.
item.author: Community

item.title: Campus Card Office Closure – Presidents Day
item.description: Please note that the Campus Card Office will be closed in observance of Presidents Day on Monday, February 16, 2026. The office will resume normal business hours on Tuesday, February 17, 2026.
item.author: Community

item.title: Information Security - Help us name our new AI Phishing Coach!
item.description: Our Information Security team is excited to announce that we will be deploying our new AI Phishing Coach, and are asking for our RPI Community’s assistance with sending us creative and fun names through our naming contest. Click above link to submit proposed names. Best name submission will win RPI merchandise! Submissions will close February 23rd.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Faculty and Staff Webinar - Strategies on Flipping Your Classroom
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, February 24, 2026 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This session will discuss the practice of moving traditional in-class lectures onto the web by creating engaging, media-rich content that student’s access before, during, or after class. Class time is refocused, allowing students to work on tasks and problems that apply the concepts they studied independently. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
